text: I love and hate this game. Â I love the setting and gameplay, but I hate that I just can't beat it!
author: BygPhattyPlus

text: It's normal. You're still in the training phase. How many runs have you done in total so far? It's normal for people's first ~30 runs to end in explosive death.
author: ZobmieRules

text: I think I have done 50 runs so far. Â I don't play it for a while after I have been crushed. Â I also make a few dumb mistakes.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text: @ZobmieRulesÂ Well, to a certain extend it's luck as well. If the RNG hates you and deals you a couple of crappy events in succession you have pretty much no option but to lose. :/
author: Metaknightkirby2

text: @Metaknightkirby2 In a rogue-like, there's always going to be luck. That said, I believe that FTL's luck-based elements aren't extreme enough to force a game-over. You can have bad runs, and still salvage them.
author: ZobmieRules
Metaknightkirby2

text: @ZobmieRules The hell they aren't.  I've been all the way to sector 8 and get hit with some real shitty luck.  Shit will shut you right down.

text:
@William Martin

text:
You can say this game is luck all you want. Still doesn't change the fact that some people are so good at this game, they have to make up extra challenges on top of the hardest difficulty to even break a sweat.
Like never pausing, only using certain weapons etc.
